sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, the Hall of a Thousand Thrones is the seat of power of the [[Pureborn]], the oligarch rulers of Qarth. To be allowed entrance into the Hall of a Thousand Thrones, petitioners must make the traditional sacrifice in the Temple of Memory, offer the traditional bribe to the Keeper of the Long List, send the traditional persimmon to the Opener of the Door, and finally receive the traditional blue silk slippers summoning him or her to the Hall of a Thousand Thrones.

Inside, the Pureborn all are enthroned on great wooden chairs of their ancestors, which rise in curved tiers from a marble floor to a high domed ceiling. The chairs are immense, fantastically carved, bright with gold work, and studded with amber, onyx, lapis and jade. Each one is different from all the others, and each one strives to be the most fabulous. The domed ceiling is painted with scenes of Qarth's vanquished glory.
